items.title: Passbolt raises $8M for its open source password manager for teams
items.author: Kevin Muller, Remy Bertot, Cédric Alfonsi
items.summary:
- Passbolt raises $8 million in a Series A funding round led by Airbridge Equity Partners to enhance its open-source password manager for teams.
- Over 38,000 teams currently use Passbolt, with 2,000 paying users opting for additional features and services.
- Passbolt aims to offer a more collaborative and secure password management solution compared to existing tools like Bitwarden or KeePass, with features like role-based access controls and a self-hosted alternative.

items.title: Hackers found a way to remotely unlock, start, and track millions of Subarus
items.author: Sam Curry, Shubham Shah
items.summary:
- A year ago, two researchers discovered vulnerabilities in a Subaru web portal allowing hijacking of car controls and tracking of driver location data.
- Subaru has fixed the vulnerabilities after the researchers reported their findings.
- The vulnerabilities also pose a broader security issue, affecting multiple automakers including Acura, Honda, Hyundai, and Toyota.

items.title: Meta’s Yann LeCun predicts a ‘new AI architectures paradigm’ within 5 years and ‘decade of robotics’
items.author: Yann LeCun, Paul Sawers
items.summary:
- Yann LeCun predicts a new paradigm of AI architectures will emerge in the next 3-5 years, surpassing existing AI capabilities.
- He anticipates the coming decade could be the ‘decade of robotics’, combining AI advancements with robotics.
- Current generative AI and large language models (LLMs) may lose relevance, facing limitations like lack of understanding, memory, reasoning, and planning capabilities.
- LeCun emphasizes the need for ‘world models’ to enhance machines' understanding of the real world.
- Meta and OpenAI are working on robotic innovations showing potential for human-like intelligence.

items.title: ChatGPT suffered a major outage this morning, but OpenAI says it’s back up
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- ChatGPT experienced a significant outage on Thursday morning, impacting user access.
- OpenAI acknowledged the issue at 5:12 a.m. Pacific and identified the cause shortly after.
- By 7:09 a.m., OpenAI reported that a fix was implemented and they were monitoring the system's performance.
- The outage also affected OpenAI's API, but it has since been resolved.
- ChatGPT outages are rare but have occurred before, including a similar situation in December.

items.title: Coval evaluates AI voice and chat agents like self-driving cars
items.author: Brooke Hopkins
items.summary:
- Coval, founded by Brooke Hopkins, evaluates AI voice and chat agents similarly to self-driving cars.
- The startup runs thousands of simulations to test agent performance for various tasks, providing metrics and customization options for companies.
- In October 2024, Coval launched its product after strong demand and raised $3.3 million in a seed round led by MaC Venture Capital.

items.title: Method is helping fintech companies like SoFi build repayment functionality into their apps
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Method simplifies debt and repayment integration for fintech apps, aiming to overcome challenges such as screen-scraping APIs.
- Founded by Jose Bethancourt, Marco del Carmen, and Mit Shah, who previously faced connectivity issues while building GradJoy.
- Utilizes consumer credit access protections to aggregate debts and execute payments on behalf of users via simple API integration.
- Supports 30 million account connections for 4 million users and has facilitated over $500 million in repayments.
- Competes with vendors like Plaid and Spinwheel but aims to reduce friction by not requiring users to re-enter financial credentials.
- Recently raised $41.5 million in Series B funding to continue product development and expansion efforts.

items.title: Hugging Face claims its new AI models are the smallest of their kind
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Hugging Face has released two new AI models: SmolVLM-256M and SmolVLM-500M.
- The models are designed for constrained devices and ideal for processing large datasets cheaply.
- SmolVLM-256M has 256 million parameters and SmolVLM-500M has 500 million parameters.
- Both models can describe images, analyze text, and answer questions about scanned documents.
- Trained using 50 datasets and Docmatix captions, developed by Hugging Face's M4 team.
- They outperform the larger Idefics 80B model on certain benchmarks.
- Available for download under an Apache 2.0 license, implying unrestricted use.
- Small models may exhibit flaws in complex reasoning tasks as per a study by Google DeepMind and others.

items.title: Snap launches a new way to reward AR creators, rolls out student pricing for Spectacles
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Snap introduces a new "Challenge Tags" rewards program for AR developers to win cash prizes for their Lenses submissions.
- The first challenge, themed "humor", runs until January 31, with prizes totaling $4,250.
- Educational pricing for Spectacles includes a student discount, with subscriptions available at $49.50/month, down from $99.
- Eligible students, teachers, and staff across several countries can access the discounted Spectacles.

items.title: Fundraise Up claims its AI can boost nonprofit donations
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Fundraise Up aims to improve donation experiences for nonprofits by utilizing AI.
- The platform allows easy integration of donation features into nonprofit websites, supporting various payment methods.
- Features include personalized donation suggestions and upgrades to recurring donations.
- Fundraise Up charges a 4% transaction fee, providing a competitive pricing model without upfront costs.
- Over 3,000 nonprofits, including major organizations like the Canadian Red Cross, are using Fundraise Up.
- Fundraise Up raised $70 million in funding to expand its services and reach new markets.

items.title: Tive’s tools help companies track the status of their shipments in real time
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Tive, founded by Krenar Komoni, develops tools for real-time freight tracking, addressing visibility issues in global supply chains.
- Tive's tracking devices monitor location, temperature, humidity, light, and physical shocks.
- Tive has over 900 customers spanning pharmaceuticals, military, and government sectors, generating revenue through software fees, tracker sales, and monitoring services.
- The company aims to reach profitability by 2026 and has grown over 50% year-over-year despite the freight recession.
- Tive raised $40 million in a Series C round to expand its workforce and product development.

items.title: Y Combinator grad Spacium raises oversubscribed $6.3M for space re-fueling
items.author: Ashi Dissanayake, Reza Fetanat, Margaux Maccoll
items.summary:
- Spacium, a startup co-founded by Ashi Dissanayake and Reza Fetanat, raised $6.3 million in an oversubscribed seed round led by Initialized Capital.
- The company aims to address the lack of in-space refueling options, which currently leads to spacecraft becoming space debris after missions.
- Spacium plans a demo mission of its product capabilities later this year and already has a strong pipeline of customers.
- Dissanayake emphasizes their unique system for long-term fuel storage as a competitive advantage over other companies in the industry, such as Orbit Fab and Astroscale.

items.title: Quantum VC QDNL hits €25M first-close on new fund
items.author: Mike Butcher
items.summary:
- VC investment in quantum computing dropped by 50% from $2.2bn in 2022 to $1.2bn in 2023, shifting towards Generative AI.
- QDNL Participations has achieved a €25 million first close for a €60 million fund targeting early-stage quantum startups.
- QDNL aims to expand investments internationally and previously focused on the Dutch quantum ecosystem with a €15 million fund.

items.title: Everstone acquires bootstrapped Indian startup Wingify for $200M
items.author: Manish Singh
items.summary:
- Private equity firm Everstone acquires a majority stake in [Wingify](https://wingify.com/) for about $200 million.
- The deal marks a significant exit for founder Paras Chopra, who bootstrapped the startup since its inception in 2010.
- Wingify's annual revenue recently reached $50 million, serving over 4,000 clients in 90 countries.
- The acquisition enhances Everstone’s technology portfolio, focusing on profitable bootstrapped companies.

items.title: African fintech Moniepoint gets Visa backing, plans to work on contactless payments
items.author: Tage Kene-Okafor
items.summary:
- Visa invests over $10 million in Moniepoint to drive financial inclusion for SMEs in Africa.
- Moniepoint's Series C funding exceeds $120 million with $110 million previously announced.
- The fintech processes over 1 billion transactions monthly, with total payment volumes reaching $22 billion.
- Plans to introduce contactless payments and expand transaction capabilities in Nigeria and beyond.
- Visa aims to digitize payments for SMEs and increase its share in Nigeria’s card market.

items.title: OpenAI may preview its agent tool for users on the $200 per month Pro plan
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- OpenAI’s agent tool, Operator, might soon be released as an early research preview for $200 Pro subscription users.  
- Code updates detected by a user indicate preparations for launch, with a new popup for Pro users prompting them to upgrade for access.  
- Operator could automate multi-step web tasks, suggesting a significant advancement in OpenAI’s tool capabilities based on previous Bloomberg and Information reports.

items.title: UK probes Apple and Google over ‘mobile ecosystem’ market power
items.author: Paul Sawers
items.summary:
- The U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) is launching investigations into Apple and Google's mobile ecosystems under the Digital Markets, Competition and Consumers Act.
- The CMA's investigations aim to determine if the companies have strategic market status and whether they dominate markets involving browsers, app stores, and operating systems.
- A previous inquiry found that Apple’s browser policies restrict competition, and the CMA plans to assess competition levels and terms imposed on app developers in the app stores.
- Stakeholders can submit comments for three weeks, with findings expected by October 22, 2025, which may lead to remedies to enhance competition.

items.title: WhatsApp wins reprieve in India over user data sharing
items.author: Manish Singh
items.summary:
- An Indian tribunal has suspended restrictions preventing WhatsApp from sharing user data with Meta.
- The ban was initially imposed by India's antitrust regulator, accusing WhatsApp of market dominance abuse.
- WhatsApp has over 700 million monthly users in India, its largest market.
- The tribunal ordered Meta to deposit approximately $12.35 million within two weeks; the case will be heard again on March 17.
- Meta's lawyers argue that upcoming digital privacy laws should govern these matters, rather than competition rules.

items.title: Neko, the body-scanning startup co-founded by Spotify’s Daniel Ek, snaps up $260M at a $1.8B valuation
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Neko Health has raised $260 million in Series B funding, valuing the company at $1.8 billion.
- The funding will help Neko expand into markets like the U.S. and develop its diagnostics further.
- The waitlist for Neko's services has increased from 40,000 to over 100,000 patients.
- The company has scanned 10,000 patients in its clinics located in Stockholm and London.
- Investors include Lightspeed Venture Partners and General Catalyst, among others.
- Neko aims to focus on preventative healthcare, emphasizing the importance of early detection and data-driven diagnostics.

items.title: Someone bought the domain ‘OGOpenAI’ and redirected it to a Chinese AI lab
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- A software engineer purchased the domain **OGOpenAI.com** and redirected it to **DeepSeek**, a Chinese AI lab.
- The domain was acquired for less than the price of a Chipotle meal, with plans to resell it later.
- **DeepSeek** is gaining attention for releasing open AI models similar to OpenAI's early offerings, allowing developers to use them offline for free.
- The redirection was inspired by a post comparing **DeepSeek** with **OpenAI** in its Open days, aiming to highlight the contrast in their current models.
- The **U.S. government** has sought to limit China's AI advancements through chip export restrictions, reflecting on the competitive landscape of AI technology.

items.title: Google buys part of HTC’s XR business for $250 million
items.summary:
- Google is acquiring a portion of HTC's extended reality (XR) business for $250 million.
- The deal includes transferring some HTC VIVE engineering staff to Google and granting non-exclusive intellectual property rights.
- HTC retains rights to use and develop the technology.
- This is Google's second major deal with HTC, following a $1.1 billion purchase of HTC's smartphone unit in 2017.
- The acquisition aims to enhance the development of the Android XR platform for headsets and glasses.
- The move is part of a competitive landscape in XR technology with rivals like Apple and Meta.

items.title: Some shareholders of a16z-backed Divvy Homes may not see a dime from $1B sale
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Divvy Homes is being acquired by Brookfield Properties for about $1 billion, reflecting a decline from its 2021 valuation of $2.3 billion.
- After paying debts and obligations, common shareholders and Series FF preferred stockholders may not receive any payout from the sale.
- Divvy Homes focuses on a rent-to-own model and has faced challenges due to rising mortgage interest rates, leading to multiple layoffs in a year.

items.title: Raymond Tonsing’s Caffeinated Capital seeks $400M for fifth fund
items.summary:
- Caffeinated Capital is raising a fifth fund of $400 million.
- The firm has already secured $160 million in commitments toward this fund.
- If successful, it will be the largest capital haul in the firm's 15-year history.
- Caffeinated Capital was an early investor in companies like Airtable and Saronic.
- Varun Gupta joined as a general partner in 2020, alongside founder Raymond Tonsing.
- Notable past investments include Affirm and Optimizely, with the latter sold for $600 million in 2020.

items.title: Ati Motors raises $20M as India’s robotics industry grows
items.author: Jagmeet Singh
items.summary:
- Ati Motors raised $20 million to fund its global expansion as an autonomous mobile robots startup.
- The Indian IT ministry proposed a National Strategy for Robotics to establish India as a global leader by 2030.
- With a growth rate of 59% YoY, India ranks as the seventh largest robotics market but trails China, Japan, and the U.S.
- Ati Motors has developed seven distinct robots capable of moving materials in factories, featuring advanced sensors and spatial awareness.
- The startup has a significant customer base, mostly in the automobile sector, and aims to expand its presence in North America, particularly Detroit.
- The Series B funding was co-led by Walden Catalyst Ventures and NGP Capital, with participation from existing investors.

items.title: Microsoft’s head of venture has resigned
items.summary:
- Chris Young, head of business development and venture unit at Microsoft, resigned on Wednesday.
- Young led Microsoft’s M12 venture fund and was a named officer, which required public reporting of his departure.
- His resignation was announced in an SEC filing, with no specific reason given for his departure.
- Young's achievements included increasing M12’s engagements in AI and data infrastructure and promoting diversity within the company.
- He joined Microsoft in 2020, replacing the former head of M12, Peggy Johnson, and helped strengthen strategic partnerships during his tenure.
- Young will remain with Microsoft until March to assist in the transition.

items.title: Nearly 10 years later, Tumblr TV launches to all as a TikTok alternative
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Tumblr TV, originally launched as a GIF discovery feature in 2015, is now available to all users as a standard feature, evolving to support video.
- The launch comes in response to the U.S. TikTok ban, creating demand for alternative platforms for short-form video content.
- On January 19, the day of the TikTok ban, Tumblr saw a 35% increase in iOS app installs and a 70% increase in new users joining Communities.
- New users will find a dedicated Tumblr TV tab in the app, while existing users can toggle it on or off in their Dashboard settings.
- Despite improvements, Tumblr TV does not replicate the original creator content style of TikTok and features animations and videos that may not fit vertical viewing formats.

items.title: Nearly 10 year later, Tumblr TV launches to all as a TikTok alternative
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Tumblr has launched Tumblr TV, evolving from an experimental feature to a full product available to all users.
- The launch is influenced by the uncertainty surrounding TikTok due to a U.S. ban, promoting demand for alternatives.
- Tumblr reported a 35% increase in iOS app installs and a 70% increase in new users joining Communities after the TikTok ban on January 19.
- Users can toggle Tumblr TV in their dashboard settings; new users will find it featured prominently.
- Tumblr hopes to attract TikTok users despite its video feed being less competitive than TikTok's original creator content focus.
- The service includes swipe-based navigation for channels but lacks optimal vertical video formatting.

items.title: Scale AI is facing a third worker lawsuit in about a month
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Scale AI is facing its third lawsuit regarding labor practices, specifically over psychological trauma from reviewing disturbing content.
- The latest class action complaint was filed on January 17, 2025, in California concerning psychological harms allegedly suffered by six workers.
- Plaintiffs claim they were misled about job expectations and faced retaliation when seeking mental health help, leading to severe mental health issues such as PTSD.
- Previous lawsuits included allegations of wage violations and misclassification as contractors.
- Scale AI's spokesperson claims the company complies with laws and has safeguards in place to protect workers.

items.title: How to Delete Facebook, Instagram, and Threads
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- Meta has loosened its content moderation policies, leading to increased searches on how to delete accounts.
- Users express anger towards CEO Mark Zuckerberg's alignment with the Trump administration and alleged misinformation spread.
- Instructions provided for downloading personal information from Facebook before deletion, emphasizing that deletion is permanent.
- Steps provided to delete Facebook, Instagram, and Threads accounts, with specific instructions for each platform.
- Deletion of Threads is tied to the deletion of the associated Instagram account and involves a 30-day processing period.

items.title: Rent-to-own startup Divvy Homes selling to Brookfield for about $1 billion
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Divvy Homes is being acquired by Brookfield Properties for approximately $1 billion.
- The acquisition price is lower than its last valuation of $2.3 billion in 2021.
- The deal is expected to close in mid-February 2025.
- Divvy's rent-to-own model helped renters aim to become homeowners.
- The company faced challenges due to rising mortgage interest rates and had three rounds of layoffs in a year.
- Founded in 2016, Divvy raised over $700 million from investors including Tiger Global Management and Andreessen Horowitz.

items.title: Microsoft’s relationship with OpenAI cracked when it hired Mustafa Suleyman, rival Marc Benioff says
items.summary:
- Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff discussed a rift between Microsoft and OpenAI during an interview at Davos.
- OpenAI is no longer exclusively partnering with Microsoft for cloud services, now looking towards a $500 billion project with SoftBank and Oracle.
- Tensions have reportedly been building since mid-2023, exacerbated by OpenAI's release of its own competing products and internal conflicts.
- Microsoft hired Mustafa Suleyman to lead its AI efforts, indicating a shift in strategy away from OpenAI.
- Benioff, who has a vested interest in OpenAI, noted visible tensions between Suleyman and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman.

items.title: AngelList, CoinList partner to help crypto startups raise and manage funds
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- AngelList and CoinList are launching Crypto SPVs (Special Purpose Vehicles) and RUVs (Roll-Up Vehicles) to assist crypto startups in raising capital.
- Users can fund Crypto SPVs in stablecoins with a current $0 fee; USDC is emphasized for easier transactions for crypto investors.
- This initiative allows investors to receive tokens instead of cash, aligning with the crypto ethos of ownership and stakeholder participation.
- Crypto Roll-Up Vehicles help startups manage investments and compliance efficiently by simplifying documentation processes with multiple angel investors.

items.title: Samsung teased an extra-thin S25 model at Unpacked
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Samsung revealed an extra-thin version of its S25 flagship, called the Galaxy S25 Edge, at the recent Unpacked event.
- The S25 Edge is expected to be thinner than the standard S25, with early rumors suggesting a thickness of 6.4 mm.
- Detailed specifications like pricing and availability were not disclosed, and the S25 Edge may affect preorders for the S25, set to release on February 7.

items.title: Researchers develop a way to power wearables through human skin
items.summary:
- Carnegie Mellon researchers have introduced a technology called [Power-Over-Skin](https://www.cs.cmu.edu/news/2025/power-over-skin) that allows electrical currents to travel through human skin to power devices.
- This technology aims to support battery-free devices, including blood sugar monitors, pacemakers, and consumer wearables like smart glasses and fitness trackers.
- The technology is currently in early stages, demonstrated with low-power electronics like LED earrings.

items.title: Samsung Unpacked: Samsung’s Galaxy S25 will support Content Credentials to identify AI-generated images
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- The Galaxy S25 will be the first smartphones to support the Content Credentials standard for identifying AI-generated content.
- This standard acts as a 'nutrition label' for digital content, detailing how it was generated and edited.
- It addresses concerns about AI's role in spreading misinformation and will apply to images, videos, audio, and documents.
- Content Credentials can be inspected using Adobe’s Content Authenticity tool, currently in beta.
- The Galaxy S25 line is available for preorder and will ship starting February 7, 2025.

items.title: This Week in AI: OpenAI gains an invaluable infrastructure advantage
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- OpenAI announced the Stargate Project with SoftBank and Oracle to build AI infrastructure in the U.S.
- Stargate could attract up to $500 billion for AI data centers over the next four years.
- OpenAI has more active users (300 million weekly) and paying business customers (over 1 million) than any other AI venture.
- The project aims to solidify OpenAI's position in the AI sector, making it difficult for rivals like Anthropic and xAI to compete.
- The first Stargate-funded data center has begun construction in Abilene, Texas, with an initial investment promise of $100 billion.

items.title: Streaming service Plex gets more social with public profiles and reviews
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Plex expands its social networking features to allow users to create public profiles and share their TV/movie reviews.
- Users can now share a public URL to their profiles and control the visibility of their ratings and reviews.
- Changes aim to help Plex compete with other free streaming services and dedicated social networks for reviews.
- Plex Pass subscribers get access to HEVC hardware encoding for improved video quality and lower bandwidth use.

items.title: Zombie nuclear reactors could be revived thanks to AI data center demand
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- Santee Cooper aims to restart construction on the Virgil C. Summer Nuclear Power Station, halted in 2017 due to budget overruns.
- The original project cost escalated from $9.8 billion to $25 billion, contributing to Westinghouse's bankruptcy.
- Interest in nuclear power is rising due to demand from AI data centers, with potential partnerships being sought by Santee Cooper.
- Microsoft and Meta are involved in related nuclear power initiatives to secure energy for their operations.
- There are political challenges related to the financing of the project that could impact ratepayers.
keywords: Virgil C. Summer Nuclear Power Station

items.title: Samsung Unpacked 2025: Samsung’s AI-focused Galaxy S25 Ultra ships February 7 for $1,300
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Samsung unveiled the Galaxy S25 series including the S25 Ultra at the annual Samsung Unpacked 2025 event.
- The Galaxy S25 Ultra priced at $1,300 features a 6.9-inch display and four rear cameras: 50MP ultra-wide, 200MP wide, and two telephoto lenses with 3x and 5x optical zoom.
- Powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip, the S25 Ultra promises a 37% CPU boost and a 40% enhancement in neural processing unit performance.
- The device offers ProScaler AI image sharpening and gaming enhancements like Vulkan Engine and Ray Tracing.
- A 5,000mAh battery, 12GB RAM, and up to 1TB storage are included along with multiple color options.
- Preorders started Wednesday with shipping set for February 7.

items.title: Samsung Unpacked: Samsung’s Galaxy S25 arrives with a better Google Gemini
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Samsung unveiled the Galaxy S25 series at Unpacked 2025, including Galaxy S25, Galaxy S25+, and Galaxy S25 Ultra.
- Google introduced improved AI assistant, Gemini, which can execute multiple app actions via a single prompt.
- New Gemini Extensions launched for Samsung Calendar, Clock, Notes, and Reminder.
- Gemini Live offers a voice-based conversational experience with features like image and file uploads.
- Upcoming Project Astra capabilities for real-time AI assistance are set to debut on Galaxy S25.
- Preorders for the Galaxy S25 series started with shipping on February 7, 2025.

items.title: Samsung Unpacked: The Samsung Galaxy S25’s side button fires up Google Gemini
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Samsung announced new features for the Galaxy S25, including easier access to Google Gemini via the side button.
- The update follows the struggle with Samsung's Bixby and the replacement of Google Home by Gemini on Android.
- The Galaxy S25 features improved AI capabilities powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip and offers cross-app functionality with Google apps.
- Preorders for the Galaxy S25 line start now, with shipping set for February 7, 2025.

items.title: Samsung Unpacked: Google makes Circle to Search more helpful
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Google announced updates to Circle to Search at [Samsung Unpacked 2025](https://techcrunch.com/storyline/samsung-unpacked-2025-live-updates-galaxy-s25-new-ai-features-and-more/).
- Circle to Search allows users to search information using gestures like circling and highlighting.
- New AI Overviews expand to visual results without needing additional text.
- Users can circle items, such as artwork, for AI-generated information and links.
- Functionality is rolling out on all Android devices.

items.title: Samsung Unpacked 2025: Samsung Galaxy S25 line compared
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Samsung announced the Galaxy S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra during Samsung Unpacked 2025 on January 22, 2025.
- The devices focus on AI enhancements, utilizing Google's Gemini platform.
- Preorders for all models began immediately, with shipping set for February 7, 2025.
- Galaxy S25 features: 6.2-inch FHD+, Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite, 4,000 mAh battery, starting at $800.
- Galaxy S25+ features: 6.7-inch QHD+, Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite, 4,900 mAh battery, starting at $1,000.
- Galaxy S25 Ultra features: 6.9-inch QHD+, 200MP rear camera, 5,000 mAh battery, starting at $1,300.

items.title: Samsung’s SmartThings to introduce AI features that simplify your daily routines
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Samsung introduced AI features for SmartThings at Samsung Unpacked 2025.
- New ‘Home AI’ features will use ambient sensing technology and generative AI for personalized experiences.
- Advanced sensor technology like mmWave and sound sensors will detect user activities (e.g., cooking, exercising) to optimize home settings.
- Users can take pictures of objects for SmartThings' Map View technology to enhance device interaction.
- All data will be stored locally, ensuring privacy and consent for data use.
- Rollout of updates planned for 2025 and 2026.

items.title: Samsung’s AI-focused Galaxy S25 Ultra ships February 7 for $1,300
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Samsung unveiled the Galaxy S25 series, focusing on mobile AI at the annual Samsung Unpacked 2025.
- The Galaxy S25 Ultra, priced at $1,300, features a 6.9-inch display and a quad-camera setup with a 50MP ultra-wide and 200MP wide cameras.
- It is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chip, promising significant performance boosts across CPU, GPU, and NPU.
- The device supports AI image sharpening and enhanced gaming graphics with the Snapdragon's advanced features.
- Google’s AI tools are integrated, including long-press access to Gemini and new AI writing features.
- The Ultra has a 5,000mAh battery, 12GB of RAM, and up to 1TB storage, with preorder starting Wednesday and shipping on February 7.

items.title: The Samsung Galaxy S25’s side button fires up Google Gemini
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Samsung Galaxy S25 line announced with new features for easier access to Google Gemini via the side button.
- This announcement follows Samsung's struggle to promote its Bixby assistant and comes as Gemini replaces Google Home on Android devices.
- Galaxy S25 to ship on February 7, with preorders currently available.

items.title: Samsung Unpacked 2025: Google is bringing improved hearing aid features
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Google announced accessibility improvements for Android during Samsung Unpacked 2025, enhancing hearing aid functionality and screen reader features.
- Updates include LE Bluetooth compatibility for hands-free calling and lower latency, rolling out with Android 16 beta updates on Galaxy S25, S24, and Pixel 9.
- The improved TalkBack screen reader will also support braille users with new HID functionality and better image descriptions from Google Gemini.

items.title: Google makes Circle to Search more helpful
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Google announced updates to Circle to Search at [Samsung Unpacked 2025](https://techcrunch.com/storyline/samsung-unpacked-2025-live-updates-galaxy-s25-new-ai-features-and-more/) to enhance user information retrieval on Android devices.
- The update expands AI Overviews for various visual results without needing to add extra text to searches.
- Users can now get quick AI snapshots of information by circling items like artwork in museums, as well as action chips for recognized numbers, email addresses, and URLs on their screens.

items.title: Samsung’s Galaxy S25 arrives with a better Google Gemini
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Samsung unveiled the Galaxy S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra at Unpacked 2025.
- An improved Google AI assistant, Gemini, was launched, allowing multi-app actions in one prompt.
- New Gemini Extensions were introduced for Samsung Calendar, Clock, Notes, and Reminder.
- Gemini Live, a voice-based feature, offers a multimodal conversational experience, including uploads of images and videos.
- Future enhancements involve Project Astra capabilities, including screen sharing and live streaming.
- The Galaxy S25 series has a new side button for quick access to Gemini tasks.
- Preorders for the Galaxy S25 series started, with shipping set for February 7.

items.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 line compared
items.author: Brian Heater
items.summary:
- Samsung unveiled three new Galaxy models: S25, S25+, and S25 Ultra at [Samsung Unpacked 2025](https://techcrunch.com/storyline/samsung-unpacked-2025-live-updates-galaxy-s25-new-ai-features-and-more/).
- Preorders are available now; shipping starts on February 7.
- Key specifications:
  - Display: S25 (6.2-inch FHD+), S25+ (6.7-inch QHD+), S25 Ultra (6.9-inch QHD+)
  - Front Camera: All models feature a 12-megapixel front camera.
  - Rear Camera: S25 and S25+ have a three-camera setup; S25 Ultra has a four-camera setup with a 200-megapixel main sensor.
  - Processor: All models utilize the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite Mobile Platform.
  - Battery: S25 (4,000 mAh), S25+ (4,900 mAh), S25 Ultra (5,000 mAh).
  - Storage: S25 (128GB/256GB), S25+ (256GB/512GB), S25 Ultra (256GB/512GB/1TB).
  - Starting Prices: S25 ($800), S25+ ($1,000), S25 Ultra ($1,300).

items.title: Elon Musk and Sam Altman take to social media to fight over Stargate
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Elon Musk and Sam Altman are publicly arguing on social media about the Stargate project for OpenAI’s data centers.
- Stargate aims to attract $500 billion for developing data centers across the U.S., with initial commitments of $100 billion.
- Musk disputes the project's financial backing, claiming SoftBank has less than $10 billion secured.
- Altman counters Musk’s claims, promoting Stargate as beneficial for the country and emphasizes his respect for Musk.
- Musk leads the DOGE commission, which aims to reduce federal spending, amidst its legal challenges.
- Industry responses include Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella affirming his company’s $80 billion commitment to AI data centers.
